remarks: Universal property of the quotient topology.  If ` G ` is a function from ` J ` to ` K ` which is equal on all equivalent elements under ` F ` , then there is a unique continuous map ` f : ( J / F ) --> K ` such that ` G = f o. F ` , and we say that ` G ` "passes to the quotient".  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Mar-2015.)
